channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes at the entrance to the McDonalds trading centre, 31st December
item.description:
When are these potholes going to be fixed once and for all rather than patched , I try to avoid my driving into the right hand lane which could cause an accident
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over 12‚Äù, large stones which hit cars and has caused damage, 31st December
item.description:
Outside number 3 Unwin Road. GL51 6 PQ. There are at least another three holes along the road from outside number 1 and just passed number 3. There are large stones being thrown up on to road and path as cars hit the holes. The holes have been there for sometime but are now causing a problem. Someone crossing the road could fall, twist ankle at the very least.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Firgrove Walk, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Under the A40 bridge footpath leading from the airport towards Chosen Hill area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 31st December
item.description:
31/12/25 email rcvd (full email trail attached) ::: Dear Highways, The drain in the road on the opposite side to numbers 52-54 St Stephens Road, Cheltenham is completely blocked with mud causing problems particularly when there is heavy rain. The gully of the road leading down to this drain is now also now very muddy. I would be grateful if you could inspect and sort this problem. Thanks. Regards,
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Well Place, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection, 31st December
item.description:
Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection. Two bags, one containing general litter and the other cans/plastic bottles for recycling. Also one nitrous oxide cylinder. Near to the Innsworth Lane Sports Ground sign. What 3 Words location ///examiner.slopes.courage The ordnance survey map reference is: 51.883919,-2.213313 Council Litter Bin Ref: 0254

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Litter picking bags ready for collection
